intro: Lathyrus albus var. versicolor, commonly known as the white-flowered pea, is a variant of the common pea plant characterized by its variable flower colors. It is a flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae, and is native to Europe and parts of Asia. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring trifoliate leaves and pods that contain several seeds. Its flowers range from white to pink and purple, depending on the variety, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
